posts.post_content: Elspeth, in all honesty, is not that great. most of the lorwyn planeswalkers could defeat her (not liliana or jace). Once you use her last ability, it helps a lot, but strategy wise, most creatures arent destroyed by kill cards, and her last ability doesnt help with enchantments, meaning, your creatures can still be enchanted. Her second ability can help a lot, but her first one isnt that great. I honestly dont think that elspeth does that much good for you, if your going to try to destroy a player, u dont use kill cards to wipe out their forces, costs too much mana, and damaging cards still work on creatures. Elspeth could be better, a lot better.
posts.html:

Once you use her last ability, it helps a lot, but strategy wise, most creatures arent destroyed by kill cards, and her last ability doesnt help with enchantments, meaning, your creatures can still be enchanted. Her second ability can help a lot, but her first one isnt that great. I honestly dont think that elspeth does that much good for you, if your going to try to destroy a player, u dont use kill cards to wipe out their forces, costs too much mana, and damaging cards still work on creatures. Elspeth could be better, a lot better.

Posted By: Elven_planeswalker (5/27/2009 4:45:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Shoe2: Hard to remove a planeswalker? Green can attack a planeswalker with big creatures that have trample, or indestructibility, or are unblockable. Blue has counterspells. Black has vampiric spells. Red has burn spells. The only deck that might have troubles removing a planeswalker is white. White has plenty of inexpensive fliers, so you could potentially kill a planeswalker with a flock of birds, but other than that, I'd say the best you could use from white would be something like a [Faith's Fetters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faith's Fetters ) or some kind of removal spell, at which white is notoriously good. In my experience playing with and against planeswalkers, they don't stay on the board very long.
posts.html:
@Shoe2: Hard to remove a planeswalker? Green can attack a planeswalker with big creatures that have trample, or indestructibility, or are unblockable. Blue has counterspells. Black has vampiric spells. Red has burn spells. The only deck that might have troubles removing a planeswalker is white. In my experience playing with and against planeswalkers, they don't stay on the board very long.

Posted By: Th3_Dark_On3 (6/3/2009 4:21:36 PM)

posts.post_content:
She is my most favorite out of all the Planeswalkers newly printed. The moment I saw her I knew I had to have her in my deck.  
  
The unique thing about Elspeth is that she doesn't follow the standard ability chart that all the rest do:  
+X: Do something, -X: Do something different, -BIGX: Do something big that has synergy with the +X ability.  
She has TWO +1 abilities that offer two very different, but very good effects.  
  
Her first is to poop out a soldier baby. People attack Elspeth's quality by saying she's a crappy [Bitterblossom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bitterblossom) . . . yeah. This effect is not as good, per sey . . . it *does* give you a 1/1 but it doesn't fly like those cute little faerie babies. But unlike [Bitterblossom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bitterblossom ) it doesn't cost life (many a Fae player's downfall) and it's not the *only* effect she wields.  
  
I actually use her second ability far more than I use her baby making potential. Giving a +3/+3 boost to a [Knight of Meadowgrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of Meadowgrain) and the... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

She has TWO +1 abilities that offer two very different, but very good effects.

Her first is to poop out a soldier baby. People attack Elspeth's quality by saying she's a crappy Bitterblossom . . . yeah. This effect is not as good, per sey . . . it does give you a 1/1 but it doesn't fly like those cute little faerie babies. But unlike Bitterblossom it doesn't cost life (many a Fae player's downfall) and it's not the only effect she wields.

I actually use her second ability far more than I use her baby making potential. Giving a +3/+3 boost to a Knight of Meadowgrain and the... (see all)

posts.post_content: Elspeth of course works great with empyrial archangel, but has some weaknesses, against a quick burn deck it's essentially a dead draw. It takes a while to activate it but you don't need to activate it's ultimate ability more than once. Like all planeswalkers it isn't as good upon second glance but it is extremely powerful in most situations and devastating in the right one.

posts.post_content: Elspeth is one of the best planeswalkers printed so far in terms of playability in the eternal formats. In dedicated control or prison decks, Elspeth is one of the best win conditions to be printed in a very long time. Given her current usage and possible future usage, I highly suggest trading for or buying a play set as soon as possible.

posts.post_content: Can ANYONE help me out with understanding The Planeswalker? I mean, I just am not 100% sure on how to deal with one when one comes out against me. For example: Can I target one with a spell or an ability? I understand they are not creatures, so creature removale spells won't bork, but how about a Boomerang? Can I return a Planeswalker to it owner's hand. Can I use a spell that says "Destroy Target Permanent?" I've been reading the rules on them...but they never fully answer all the possibilities. Can someone please help a girl out???

Posted By: Robin1990 (7/19/2009 10:34:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She's easily built up for her indestructible bomb, but her build up abilities are honestly conditional in use and she's a very large target which will likely be steamrolled before she can pop if the other player is smart.  
  
Without having any unconditionally useful abilities such as [Garruk Wildspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Wildspeaker)'s land uptap or [Sarkhan Vol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan Vol)'s much larger and much more intimidating summon power I just feel that she's lacking. Indestructible doesn't give them immunities to spells or abilities your opponents control, so really all she has going for her is that she has one mediocre ability that will likely only get any use 1/4 of the time.  
  
I really can't say it any clearer than that. Indestructible just isn't tempting enough for me to seriously use, especially because it's a very flimsy defense compared to what could be. (Indestructible is really nothing more than a permanent regenerate shield, which is only slightly better than regenerate.)
posts.html:

Without having any unconditionally useful abilities such as Garruk Wildspeaker's land uptap or Sarkhan Vol's much larger and much more intimidating summon power I just feel that she's lacking. Indestructible doesn't give them immunities to spells or abilities your opponents control, so really all she has going for her is that she has one mediocre ability that will likely only get any use 1/4 of the time.

I really can't say it any clearer than that. Indestructible just isn't tempting enough for me to seriously use, especially because it's a very flimsy defense compared to what could be. (Indestructible is really nothing more than a permanent regenerate shield, which is only slightly better than regenerate.)
